intro: Talisia mollis var. marleneana, commonly known as the Marlene's talisia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
